revised_title: Nehemiah Grew: The Founding Father of Plant Anatomy
tldr: The article discusses the botanical works of Nehemiah Grew, an early plant anatomist and a member of the Royal Society. Grew's work laid the foundations of plant anatomy in English, and his contributions to the field include the study of plant structures using microscopy. His publications, such as The Anatomy of Vegetables and The Anatomy of Plants, helped define the scope and content of botany as a separate discipline.
